pair.Prompt: In FTC v. TICOR TITLE INS. CO., 504 U.S. 621 (1992), what was the Court's standard for active supervision?
pair.Response: Response: In FTC v. TICOR TITLE INS. CO., 504 U.S. 621 (1992), the Court's standard for active supervision was that private parties acting pursuant to a regulatory scheme enacted by a state legislature must prove that "the State has played a substantial role in determining the specifics of the economic policy."
